Package de.uni_mannheim.informatik.dws.melt.matching_ml.python.nlptransformers

Enum TransformersMultiProcessing

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<TransformersMultiProcessing>
de.uni_mannheim.informatik.dws.melt.matching_ml.python.nlptransformers.TransformersMultiProcessing
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<TransformersMultiProcessing>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum TransformersMultiProcessing extends Enum<TransformersMultiProcessing>
The transformers library may not free all memory from GPU. Thus the prediction and training are wrapped in an external process. This enum defines how the process is started and if multiprocessing should be used at all.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    DEFAULT_MULTI_PROCESS
    This uses the default start method for the operating system.
    FORK
    This uses os.fork() to fork the python interpreter.
    FORKSERVER
    This uses a server process to start a new process.
    NO_MULTI_PROCESS
    The transformer model is executed directly in the main process.
    SPAWN
    The main process starts a fresh python interpreter.

  • Enum Constant Details

    • NO_MULTI_PROCESS

      public static final TransformersMultiProcessing NO_MULTI_PROCESS
      The transformer model is executed directly in the main process. If you call the Transformers matcher in MELT multiple times, then this can lead to memory issues.

    • DEFAULT_MULTI_PROCESS

      public static final TransformersMultiProcessing DEFAULT_MULTI_PROCESS
      This uses the default start method for the operating system. This is SPAWN for Windows and macOS, and FORK for Unix. See also the python documentation about it.

    • SPAWN

      public static final TransformersMultiProcessing SPAWN
      The main process starts a fresh python interpreter. Available on Unix and Windows. See also the python documentation about it.

    • FORK

      public static final TransformersMultiProcessing FORK
      This uses os.fork() to fork the python interpreter. Available on Unix only. This may result in the following error: Cannot re-initialize CUDA in forked subprocess. To use CUDA with multiprocessing, you must use the 'spawn' start method. . See also the python documentation about it.

    • FORKSERVER

      public static final TransformersMultiProcessing FORKSERVER
      This uses a server process to start a new process. Available only on Unix. See also the python documentation about it.
